Assuming a dataset of N+Ns𝑁subscript𝑁𝑠N+N_{s}italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT words {𝐞i}i=1N+Nssuperscriptsubscriptsubscript𝐞𝑖𝑖1𝑁subscript𝑁𝑠\{{\bf e}_{i}\}_{i=1}^{N+N_{s}}{ bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and taking the associated weights wisubscript𝑤𝑖w_{i}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for each word into account, the log-likelihood of the dataset can be written as

∑i=1N+Nsp⁢(𝐞i|{𝝁k,𝚺k}k=1K,𝝅)=∑i=1Nlog⁢∑k=1Kwi⁢𝝅k⁢𝒩⁢(𝐞i;𝝁k,𝚺k)+∑i=N+1N+Nslog⁢∑k=1Kwi⁢𝝅k⁢𝒩⁢(𝐞i;𝝁k,𝚺k).superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑁subscript𝑁𝑠𝑝conditionalsubscript𝐞𝑖superscriptsubscriptsubscript𝝁𝑘subscript𝚺𝑘𝑘1𝐾𝝅superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑁superscriptsubscript𝑘1𝐾subscript𝑤𝑖subscript𝝅𝑘𝒩subscript𝐞𝑖subscript𝝁𝑘subscript𝚺𝑘superscriptsubscript𝑖𝑁1𝑁subscript𝑁𝑠superscriptsubscript𝑘1𝐾subscript𝑤𝑖subscript𝝅𝑘𝒩subscript𝐞𝑖subscript𝝁𝑘subscript𝚺𝑘\displaystyle\sum_{i=1}^{N+N_{s}}p({\bf e}_{i}|\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$% \unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}\}_{k=1}^{K},\mbox{% \boldmath$\pi$\unboldmath})=\sum_{i=1}^{N}\log\sum_{k=1}^{K}w_{i}\mbox{% \boldmath$\pi$\unboldmath}_{k}\mathcal{N}({\bf e}_{i};\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$% \unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k})+\sum_{i=N+1}^{N+N_{s% }}\log\sum_{k=1}^{K}w_{i}\mbox{\boldmath$\pi$\unboldmath}_{k}\mathcal{N}({\bf e% }_{i};\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}% _{k}).∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | { bold_italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , bold_italic_π ) = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_N ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_N ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . (26)

Leveraging Jensen’s inequality, we obtain a lower bound of the above quantity (denoting as 𝚯𝚯\Thetabold_Θ the collection of parameters {𝝁k,𝚺k}k=1Ksuperscriptsubscriptsubscript𝝁𝑘subscript𝚺𝑘𝑘1𝐾\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}% \}_{k=1}^{K}{ bold_italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and 𝝅𝝅\pibold_italic_π):

ℒGMM⁢(𝚯,{wi})=∑i=1Nwi⁢log⁢∑k=1Kπk⁢𝒩⁢(𝐞i;𝝁k,𝚺k)+∑i=N+1N+Nswi⁢log⁢∑k=1Kπk⁢𝒩⁢(𝐞i;𝝁k,𝚺k)+C,subscriptℒGMM𝚯subscript𝑤𝑖superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑁subscript𝑤𝑖superscriptsubscript𝑘1𝐾subscript𝜋𝑘𝒩subscript𝐞𝑖subscript𝝁𝑘subscript𝚺𝑘superscriptsubscript𝑖𝑁1𝑁subscript𝑁𝑠subscript𝑤𝑖superscriptsubscript𝑘1𝐾subscript𝜋𝑘𝒩subscript𝐞𝑖subscript𝝁𝑘subscript𝚺𝑘𝐶\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath},\{w_% {i}\})=\sum_{i=1}^{N}w_{i}\log\sum_{k=1}^{K}\pi_{k}\mathcal{N}({\bf e}_{i};% \mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k})+% \sum_{i=N+1}^{N+N_{s}}w_{i}\log\sum_{k=1}^{K}\pi_{k}\mathcal{N}({\bf e}_{i};% \mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k})+C,caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ , { italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } ) = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_N ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_N ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_C , (27)

where C is a constant.

In the following theoretical analysis, we consider the following three different configurations of the weights wisubscript𝑤𝑖w_{i}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Definition I.1 (Weight Configurations).

We define three different weight configurations as follows:

  • •

    Identical Weights: wi=1N+Nssubscript𝑤𝑖1𝑁subscript𝑁𝑠w_{i}=\tfrac{1}{N+N_{s}}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG, i∈{1,2,…,N+Ns}𝑖12…𝑁subscript𝑁𝑠i\in\{1,2,\dots,N+N_{s}\}italic_i ∈ { 1 , 2 , … , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }

  • •

    Ground-Truth Weights : wi={1N,i∈{1,2,…,N}0,i∈{N+1,N+2,…,N+Ns}subscript𝑤𝑖cases1𝑁𝑖12…𝑁otherwise0𝑖𝑁1𝑁2…𝑁subscript𝑁𝑠otherwisew_{i}=\begin{cases}\tfrac{1}{N},~{}~{}i\in\{1,2,\dots,N\}\\ 0,~{}~{}i\in\{N+1,N+2,\dots,N+N_{s}\}\end{cases}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { start_ROW start_CELL divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , italic_i ∈ { 1 , 2 , … , italic_N } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 , italic_i ∈ { italic_N + 1 , italic_N + 2 , … , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW

  • •

    Attention-Based Weights: wi={λ1∈[1N+Ns,1N],i∈{1,2,…,N}λ2∈[0,1N+Ns],i∈{N+1,N+2,…,N+Ns}subscript𝑤𝑖casesformulae-sequencesubscript𝜆11𝑁subscript𝑁𝑠1𝑁𝑖12…𝑁otherwiseformulae-sequencesubscript𝜆201𝑁subscript𝑁𝑠𝑖𝑁1𝑁2…𝑁subscript𝑁𝑠otherwisew_{i}=\begin{cases}\lambda_{1}\in[\tfrac{1}{N+N_{s}},\tfrac{1}{N}],~{}~{}i\in% \{1,2,\dots,N\}\\ \lambda_{2}\in[0,\tfrac{1}{N+N_{s}}],~{}~{}i\in\{N+1,N+2,\dots,N+N_{s}\}\end{cases}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { start_ROW start_CELL italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ [ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ] , italic_i ∈ { 1 , 2 , … , italic_N } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ [ 0 , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ] , italic_i ∈ { italic_N + 1 , italic_N + 2 , … , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW

Definition I.2 (Advanced Weight Configurations).

We define three different weight configurations as follows:

  • •

    Identical Weights: wi=1N+Nssubscript𝑤𝑖1𝑁subscript𝑁𝑠w_{i}=\tfrac{1}{N+N_{s}}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG, i∈{1,2,…,N+Ns}𝑖12…𝑁subscript𝑁𝑠i\in\{1,2,\dots,N+N_{s}\}italic_i ∈ { 1 , 2 , … , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }

  • •

    Ground-Truth Weights : wi={1N,i∈{1,2,…,N}0,i∈{N+1,N+2,…,N+Ns}subscript𝑤𝑖cases1𝑁𝑖12…𝑁otherwise0𝑖𝑁1𝑁2…𝑁subscript𝑁𝑠otherwisew_{i}=\begin{cases}\tfrac{1}{N},~{}~{}i\in\{1,2,\dots,N\}\\ 0,~{}~{}i\in\{N+1,N+2,\dots,N+N_{s}\}\end{cases}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { start_ROW start_CELL divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , italic_i ∈ { 1 , 2 , … , italic_N } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 , italic_i ∈ { italic_N + 1 , italic_N + 2 , … , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW

  • •

    Attention-Based Weights: wi∈{[1N+Ns,1N],i∈{1,2,…,N}[0,1N+Ns],i∈{N+1,N+2,…,N+Ns}subscript𝑤𝑖cases1𝑁subscript𝑁𝑠1𝑁𝑖12…𝑁otherwise01𝑁subscript𝑁𝑠𝑖𝑁1𝑁2…𝑁subscript𝑁𝑠otherwisew_{i}\in\begin{cases}[\tfrac{1}{N+N_{s}},\tfrac{1}{N}],~{}~{}i\in\{1,2,\dots,N% \}\\ [0,\tfrac{1}{N+N_{s}}],~{}~{}i\in\{N+1,N+2,\dots,N+N_{s}\}\end{cases}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ { start_ROW start_CELL [ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ] , italic_i ∈ { 1 , 2 , … , italic_N } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL [ 0 , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ] , italic_i ∈ { italic_N + 1 , italic_N + 2 , … , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW

Definition I.3 (Optimal Parameters).

With Definition I.1, the corresponding optimal parameters are then defined as follows:

𝚯I=arg⁡max𝚯⁡ℒ⁢(𝚯;𝐰→Identical),subscript𝚯𝐼subscript𝚯ℒ→𝚯𝐰Identical\displaystyle\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I}=\arg\max_{\mbox{\boldmath% $\Theta$\unboldmath}}\mathcal{L}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};{\bf w}% \rightarrow\mbox{Identical}),bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L ( bold_Θ ; bold_w → Identical ) , (28)
𝚯G=arg⁡max𝚯⁡ℒ⁢(𝚯;𝐰→GT),subscript𝚯𝐺subscript𝚯ℒ→𝚯𝐰GT\displaystyle\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}=\arg\max_{\mbox{\boldmath% $\Theta$\unboldmath}}\mathcal{L}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};{\bf w}% \rightarrow\mbox{GT}),bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L ( bold_Θ ; bold_w → GT ) , (29)
𝚯A=arg⁡max𝚯⁡ℒ⁢(𝚯;𝐰→Attention),subscript𝚯𝐴subscript𝚯ℒ→𝚯𝐰Attention\displaystyle\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}=\arg\max_{\mbox{\boldmath% $\Theta$\unboldmath}}\mathcal{L}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};{\bf w}% \rightarrow\mbox{Attention}),bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L ( bold_Θ ; bold_w → Attention ) , (30)

where 𝐰→Identical→𝐰Identical{\bf w}\rightarrow\mbox{Identical}bold_w → Identical, 𝐰→GT→𝐰GT{\bf w}\rightarrow\mbox{GT}bold_w → GT, and 𝐰→Attention→𝐰Attention{\bf w}\rightarrow\mbox{Attention}bold_w → Attention indicates that ‘Identical Weights’, ‘Ground-Truth Weights’, and ‘Attention-Based Weights’ are used, respectively.

Lemma I.1.

Suppose we have two series of functions {f1,i⁢(x)}subscript𝑓1𝑖𝑥\{f_{1,i}(x)\}{ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) } and {f2,i⁢(x)}subscript𝑓2𝑖𝑥\{f_{2,i}(x)\}{ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) }, with two non-negative weighting parameters λ1,λ2subscript𝜆1subscript𝜆2\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2}italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT satisfying N⁢λ1+Ns⁢λ2=1𝑁subscript𝜆1subscript𝑁𝑠subscript𝜆21N\lambda_{1}+N_{s}\lambda_{2}=1italic_N italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1. We define the final objective function f⁢(⋅)𝑓⋅f(\cdot)italic_f ( ⋅ ) as:

f⁢(x;λ1,λ2)=λ1⁢∑i=1Nf1,i⁢(x)+λ2⁢∑i=N+1Nsf2,i⁢(x).𝑓𝑥subscript𝜆1subscript𝜆2subscript𝜆1superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑁subscript𝑓1𝑖𝑥subscript𝜆2superscriptsubscript𝑖𝑁1subscript𝑁𝑠subscript𝑓2𝑖𝑥\displaystyle f(x;\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2})=\lambda_{1}\sum_{i=1}^{N}f_{1,i}(x)% +\lambda_{2}\sum_{i=N+1}^{N_{s}}f_{2,i}(x).italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) + italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) . (31)

We assume two pairs of parameters (λ1,λ2)subscript𝜆1subscript𝜆2(\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2})( italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and (λ1′,λ2′)subscriptsuperscript𝜆′1subscriptsuperscript𝜆′2(\lambda^{\prime}_{1},\lambda^{\prime}_{2})( italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), where

λ1≥λ1′,subscript𝜆1subscriptsuperscript𝜆′1\displaystyle\lambda_{1}\geq\lambda^{\prime}_{1},italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≥ italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (32)
λ2≤λ2′.subscript𝜆2subscriptsuperscript𝜆′2\displaystyle\lambda_{2}\leq\lambda^{\prime}_{2}.italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (33)

Defining the optimal values of the objective function for different weighting parameters as

x^=arg⁡maxx⁡f⁢(x;λ1,λ2),^𝑥subscript𝑥𝑓𝑥subscript𝜆1subscript𝜆2\displaystyle\widehat{x}=\arg\max_{x}f(x;\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2}),over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG = roman_arg roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (34)
x^′=arg⁡maxx⁡f⁢(x;λ1′,λ2′),superscript^𝑥′subscript𝑥𝑓𝑥subscriptsuperscript𝜆′1subscriptsuperscript𝜆′2\displaystyle\widehat{x}^{\prime}=\arg\max_{x}f(x;\lambda^{\prime}_{1},\lambda% ^{\prime}_{2}),over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (35)

we then have that

f⁢(x^;1N,0)≥f⁢(x^′;1N,0).𝑓^𝑥1𝑁0𝑓superscript^𝑥′1𝑁0\displaystyle f(\widehat{x};\tfrac{1}{N},0)\geq f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};\tfrac{% 1}{N},0).italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , 0 ) ≥ italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , 0 ) . (36)
Proof.

We prove this theorem by contradiction. Suppose that we have

f⁢(x^;1N,0)<f⁢(x^′;1N,0).𝑓^𝑥1𝑁0𝑓superscript^𝑥′1𝑁0\displaystyle f(\widehat{x};\tfrac{1}{N},0)<f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};\tfrac{1}{N% },0).italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , 0 ) < italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , 0 ) . (37)

According to Eq. 32, i.e., λ1≥λ1′subscript𝜆1subscriptsuperscript𝜆′1\lambda_{1}\geq\lambda^{\prime}_{1}italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≥ italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and the equation N⁢λ1+Ns⁢λ2=1𝑁subscript𝜆1subscript𝑁𝑠subscript𝜆21N\lambda_{1}+N_{s}\lambda_{2}=1italic_N italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1, we have

λ1⁢λ2′=λ1⁢1−N⁢λ1′Ns≥λ1′⁢1−N⁢λ1Ns=λ1′⁢λ2.subscript𝜆1subscriptsuperscript𝜆′2subscript𝜆11𝑁subscriptsuperscript𝜆′1subscript𝑁𝑠subscriptsuperscript𝜆′11𝑁subscript𝜆1subscript𝑁𝑠subscriptsuperscript𝜆′1subscript𝜆2\displaystyle\lambda_{1}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}=\lambda_{1}\tfrac{1-N\lambda^{% \prime}_{1}}{N_{s}}\geq\lambda^{\prime}_{1}\tfrac{1-N\lambda_{1}}{N_{s}}=% \lambda^{\prime}_{1}\lambda_{2}.italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 - italic_N italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ≥ italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 - italic_N italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG = italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (38)

According to Eq. 35, we have the following equality:

f⁢(x^;λ1′,λ2′)≤f⁢(x^′;λ1′,λ2′).𝑓^𝑥subscriptsuperscript𝜆′1subscriptsuperscript𝜆′2𝑓superscript^𝑥′subscriptsuperscript𝜆′1subscriptsuperscript𝜆′2\displaystyle f(\widehat{x};\lambda^{\prime}_{1},\lambda^{\prime}_{2})\leq f(% \widehat{x}^{\prime};\lambda^{\prime}_{1},\lambda^{\prime}_{2}).italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≤ italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . (39)

Combined with the aforementioned assumption in Eq. 37, we have that

λ2′⁢f⁢(x^;λ1,λ2)=λ1⁢λ2′⁢∑i=1Nf1,i⁢(x^)+λ2⁢λ2′⁢∑i=N+1Nsf2,i⁢(x^)subscriptsuperscript𝜆′2𝑓^𝑥subscript𝜆1subscript𝜆2subscript𝜆1subscriptsuperscript𝜆′2superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑁subscript𝑓1𝑖^𝑥subscript𝜆2subscriptsuperscript𝜆′2superscriptsubscript𝑖𝑁1subscript𝑁𝑠subscript𝑓2𝑖^𝑥\displaystyle\lambda^{\prime}_{2}f(\widehat{x};\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2})=% \lambda_{1}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}\sum_{i=1}^{N}f_{1,i}(\widehat{x})+\lambda_{2}% \lambda^{\prime}_{2}\sum_{i=N+1}^{N_{s}}f_{2,i}(\widehat{x})italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ) + italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ) (40)
=\displaystyle== (λ1′⁢λ2⁢∑i=1Nf1,i⁢(x^)+λ2′⁢λ2⁢∑i=N+1Nsf2,i⁢(x^))+(N⁢(λ1⁢λ2′−λ1′⁢λ2)⋅1N⁢∑i=1Nf1,i⁢(x^))subscriptsuperscript𝜆′1subscript𝜆2superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑁subscript𝑓1𝑖^𝑥subscriptsuperscript𝜆′2subscript𝜆2superscriptsubscript𝑖𝑁1subscript𝑁𝑠subscript𝑓2𝑖^𝑥⋅𝑁subscript𝜆1subscriptsuperscript𝜆′2subscriptsuperscript𝜆′1subscript𝜆21𝑁superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑁subscript𝑓1𝑖^𝑥\displaystyle(\lambda^{\prime}_{1}\lambda_{2}\sum_{i=1}^{N}f_{1,i}(\widehat{x}% )+\lambda^{\prime}_{2}\lambda_{2}\sum_{i=N+1}^{N_{s}}f_{2,i}(\widehat{x}))+(N(% \lambda_{1}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}-\lambda^{\prime}_{1}\lambda_{2})\cdot\tfrac{1}% {N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}f_{1,i}(\widehat{x}))( italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ) + italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ) ) + ( italic_N ( italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ⋅ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ) ) (41)
=\displaystyle== λ2⁢f⁢(x^;λ1′,λ2′)+N⁢(λ1⁢λ2′−λ1′⁢λ2)⁢f⁢(x^;1N,0)subscript𝜆2𝑓^𝑥subscriptsuperscript𝜆′1subscriptsuperscript𝜆′2𝑁subscript𝜆1subscriptsuperscript𝜆′2subscriptsuperscript𝜆′1subscript𝜆2𝑓^𝑥1𝑁0\displaystyle{\lambda_{2}}f(\widehat{x};\lambda^{\prime}_{1},\lambda^{\prime}_% {2})+N(\lambda_{1}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}-\lambda^{\prime}_{1}\lambda_{2})f(% \widehat{x};\tfrac{1}{N},0)italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_N ( italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , 0 ) (42)
<\displaystyle<< λ2⁢f⁢(x^′;λ1′,λ2′)+N⁢(λ1⁢λ2′−λ1′⁢λ2)⁢f⁢(x^′;1N,0)subscript𝜆2𝑓superscript^𝑥′subscriptsuperscript𝜆′1subscriptsuperscript𝜆′2𝑁subscript𝜆1subscriptsuperscript𝜆′2subscriptsuperscript𝜆′1subscript𝜆2𝑓superscript^𝑥′1𝑁0\displaystyle{\lambda_{2}}f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};\lambda^{\prime}_{1},\lambda^% {\prime}_{2})+N(\lambda_{1}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}-{\lambda^{\prime}_{1}\lambda_{% 2}})f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};\tfrac{1}{N},0)italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_N ( italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , 0 ) (43)
=\displaystyle== (λ1′⁢λ2⁢∑i=1Nf1,i⁢(x^′)+λ2′⁢λ2⁢∑i=N+1Nsf2,i⁢(x^′))+(N⁢(λ1⁢λ2′−λ1′⁢λ2)⋅1N⁢∑i=1Nf1,i⁢(x^′))subscriptsuperscript𝜆′1subscript𝜆2superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑁subscript𝑓1𝑖superscript^𝑥′subscriptsuperscript𝜆′2subscript𝜆2superscriptsubscript𝑖𝑁1subscript𝑁𝑠subscript𝑓2𝑖superscript^𝑥′⋅𝑁subscript𝜆1subscriptsuperscript𝜆′2subscriptsuperscript𝜆′1subscript𝜆21𝑁superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑁subscript𝑓1𝑖superscript^𝑥′\displaystyle(\lambda^{\prime}_{1}\lambda_{2}\sum_{i=1}^{N}f_{1,i}(\widehat{x}% ^{\prime})+\lambda^{\prime}_{2}\lambda_{2}\sum_{i=N+1}^{N_{s}}f_{2,i}(\widehat% {x}^{\prime}))+(N(\lambda_{1}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}-\lambda^{\prime}_{1}\lambda_% {2})\cdot\tfrac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}f_{1,i}(\widehat{x}^{\prime}))( italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) + ( italic_N ( italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ⋅ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) (44)
=\displaystyle== λ1⁢λ2′⁢∑i=1Nf1,i⁢(x^′)+λ2⁢λ2′⁢∑i=N+1Nsf2,i⁢(x^′)subscript𝜆1subscriptsuperscript𝜆′2superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑁subscript𝑓1𝑖superscript^𝑥′subscript𝜆2subscriptsuperscript𝜆′2superscriptsubscript𝑖𝑁1subscript𝑁𝑠subscript𝑓2𝑖superscript^𝑥′\displaystyle\lambda_{1}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}\sum_{i=1}^{N}f_{1,i}(\widehat{x}^% {\prime})+\lambda_{2}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}\sum_{i=N+1}^{N_{s}}f_{2,i}(\widehat{% x}^{\prime})italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) (45)
=\displaystyle== λ2′⁢f⁢(x^′;λ1,λ2),subscriptsuperscript𝜆′2𝑓superscript^𝑥′subscript𝜆1subscript𝜆2\displaystyle\lambda^{\prime}_{2}f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2% }),italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (46)

which contradicts the definition of x^^𝑥\widehat{x}over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG in Eq. 34 (i.e., x^^𝑥\widehat{x}over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG maximizes f⁢(x;λ1,λ2)𝑓𝑥subscript𝜆1subscript𝜆2f(x;\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2})italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )), completing the proof. ∎

Lemma I.2.

Suppose we have two series of functions {f1,i⁢(x)}subscript𝑓1𝑖𝑥\{f_{1,i}(x)\}{ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) } and {f2,i⁢(x)}subscript𝑓2𝑖𝑥\{f_{2,i}(x)\}{ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) }, with two series of non-negative weighting parameters 𝛌1=[λ1,i]i=1N,𝛌2=[λ2,i]i=N+1Nsformulae-sequencesubscript𝛌1superscriptsubscriptdelimited-[]subscript𝜆1𝑖𝑖1𝑁subscript𝛌2subscriptsuperscriptdelimited-[]subscript𝜆2𝑖subscript𝑁𝑠𝑖𝑁1\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{1}=[\lambda_{1,i}]_{i=1}^{N},\mbox{% \boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2}=[\lambda_{2,i}]^{N_{s}}_{i=N+1}bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT satisfying ∑i=1Nλ1,i+∑i=N+1Nsλ2,i=1superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑁subscript𝜆1𝑖superscriptsubscript𝑖𝑁1subscript𝑁𝑠subscript𝜆2𝑖1\sum_{i=1}^{N}\lambda_{1,i}+\sum_{i=N+1}^{N_{s}}\lambda_{2,i}=1∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1. We define the final objective function f⁢(⋅)𝑓⋅f(\cdot)italic_f ( ⋅ ) as:

f⁢(x;𝝀1,𝝀2)=∑i=1Nλ1,i⁢f1,i⁢(x)+∑i=N+1Nsλ2,i⁢f2,i⁢(x).𝑓𝑥subscript𝝀1subscript𝝀2superscriptsubscript𝑖1𝑁subscript𝜆1𝑖subscript𝑓1𝑖𝑥superscriptsubscript𝑖𝑁1subscript𝑁𝑠subscript𝜆2𝑖subscript𝑓2𝑖𝑥\displaystyle f(x;\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{1},\mbox{\boldmath$% \lambda$\unboldmath}_{2})=\sum_{i=1}^{N}\lambda_{1,i}f_{1,i}(x)+\sum_{i=N+1}^{% N_{s}}\lambda_{2,i}f_{2,i}(x).italic_f ( italic_x ; bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) + ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) . (47)

We assume two pairs of parameters (𝛌1,𝛌2)subscript𝛌1subscript𝛌2(\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{1},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}% _{2})( bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and (𝛌1′,𝛌2′)subscriptsuperscript𝛌′1subscriptsuperscript𝛌′2(\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}^{\prime}_{1},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$% \unboldmath}^{\prime}_{2})( bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), where

λ1,i≥λ1,i′,i∈{1,2,…,N},formulae-sequencesubscript𝜆1𝑖subscriptsuperscript𝜆′1𝑖𝑖12…𝑁\displaystyle\lambda_{1,i}\geq\lambda^{\prime}_{1,i},~{}~{}i\in\{1,2,...,N\},italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≥ italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i ∈ { 1 , 2 , … , italic_N } , (48)
λ2,i≤λ2,i′,i∈{N+1,N+2,…,Ns}.formulae-sequencesubscript𝜆2𝑖subscriptsuperscript𝜆′2𝑖𝑖𝑁1𝑁2…subscript𝑁𝑠\displaystyle\lambda_{2,i}\leq\lambda^{\prime}_{2,i},~{}~{}i\in\{N+1,N+2,...,N% _{s}\}.italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i ∈ { italic_N + 1 , italic_N + 2 , … , italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } . (49)

Defining the optimal values of the objective function for different weighting parameters as

x^=arg⁡maxx⁡f⁢(x;𝝀1,𝝀2),^𝑥subscript𝑥𝑓𝑥subscript𝝀1subscript𝝀2\displaystyle\widehat{x}=\arg\max_{x}f(x;\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_% {1},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2}),over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG = roman_arg roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_x ; bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (50)
x^′=arg⁡maxx⁡f⁢(x;𝝀1′,𝝀2′),superscript^𝑥′subscript𝑥𝑓𝑥subscriptsuperscript𝝀′1subscriptsuperscript𝝀′2\displaystyle\widehat{x}^{\prime}=\arg\max_{x}f(x;\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$% \unboldmath}^{\prime}_{1},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}^{\prime}_{2}),over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_x ; bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (51)
x∗=arg⁡max⁡f⁢(x,𝟏N,𝟎).superscript𝑥𝑓𝑥1𝑁0\displaystyle x^{*}=\arg\max f(x,\tfrac{{\bf 1}}{N},{\bf 0}).italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_max italic_f ( italic_x , divide start_ARG bold_1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , bold_0 ) . (52)

Under the following Assumptions (with 𝟏1{\bf 1}bold_1 and 𝟎0{\bf 0}bold_0 denoting vectors with all entries equal to 1111 and 00, respectively):

  1. 1.

    f⁢(x^,𝟎,𝝀2)≤f⁢(x^′,𝟎,𝝀2)𝑓^𝑥0subscript𝝀2𝑓superscript^𝑥′0subscript𝝀2f(\widehat{x},{\bf 0},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2})\leq f(\widehat% {x}^{\prime},{\bf 0},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2})italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG , bold_0 , bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≤ italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , bold_0 , bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

  2. 2.

    f⁢(x;𝝀,𝟎)≥f⁢(x′;𝝀,𝟎)𝑓𝑥𝝀0𝑓superscript𝑥′𝝀0f(x;\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath},{\bf 0})\geq f(x^{\prime};\mbox{% \boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath},{\bf 0})italic_f ( italic_x ; bold_italic_λ , bold_0 ) ≥ italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; bold_italic_λ , bold_0 ), iff ‖x−x∗‖≤‖x′−x∗‖,𝝀≥0,‖𝝀‖1=1formulae-sequencenorm𝑥superscript𝑥normsuperscript𝑥′superscript𝑥formulae-sequence𝝀0subscriptnorm𝝀11\|x-x^{*}\|\leq\|x^{\prime}-x^{*}\|,~{}~{}\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}% \geq 0,~{}~{}\|\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}\|_{1}=1∥ italic_x - italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ ≤ ∥ italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ , bold_italic_λ ≥ 0 , ∥ bold_italic_λ ∥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1.

we have that

f⁢(x^;𝟏N,𝟎)≥f⁢(x^′;𝟏N,𝟎).𝑓^𝑥1𝑁0𝑓superscript^𝑥′1𝑁0\displaystyle f(\widehat{x};\tfrac{{\bf 1}}{N},{\bf 0})\geq f(\widehat{x}^{% \prime};\tfrac{{\bf 1}}{N},{\bf 0}).italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; divide start_ARG bold_1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , bold_0 ) ≥ italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; divide start_ARG bold_1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , bold_0 ) . (53)
Proof.

We start with proving the following equality by contradiction:

‖x^−x∗‖≤‖x^′−x∗‖.norm^𝑥superscript𝑥normsuperscript^𝑥′superscript𝑥\displaystyle\|\widehat{x}-x^{*}\|\leq\|\widehat{x}^{\prime}-x^{*}\|.∥ over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG - italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ ≤ ∥ over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ . (54)

Specifically, if

‖x^−x∗‖>‖x^′−x∗‖,norm^𝑥superscript𝑥normsuperscript^𝑥′superscript𝑥\displaystyle\|\widehat{x}-x^{*}\|>\|\widehat{x}^{\prime}-x^{*}\|,∥ over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG - italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ > ∥ over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∥ , (55)

leveraging the Assumption 1 and 2 above, we have that

f⁢(x^;𝝀1,𝝀2)=f⁢(x^;𝝀1,𝟎)+f⁢(x^;𝟎,𝝀2)<f⁢(x^′;𝝀1,𝟎)+f⁢(x^′;𝟎,𝝀2)=f⁢(x^′;𝝀1,𝝀2),𝑓^𝑥subscript𝝀1subscript𝝀2𝑓^𝑥subscript𝝀10𝑓^𝑥0subscript𝝀2𝑓superscript^𝑥′subscript𝝀10𝑓superscript^𝑥′0subscript𝝀2𝑓superscript^𝑥′subscript𝝀1subscript𝝀2\displaystyle f(\widehat{x};\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{1},\mbox{% \boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2})=f(\widehat{x};\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$% \unboldmath}_{1},{\bf 0})+f(\widehat{x};{\bf 0},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$% \unboldmath}_{2})<f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_% {1},{\bf 0})+f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};{\bf 0},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$% \unboldmath}_{2})=f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_% {1},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2}),italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_0 ) + italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; bold_0 , bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) < italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_0 ) + italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; bold_0 , bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (56)

which contradicts Eq. 50. Therefore,  Eq. 54 holds.

Combining Eq. 54 and Assumption 2 above, we have that

f⁢(x^;𝟏N,𝟎)≥f⁢(x^′;𝟏N,𝟎),𝑓^𝑥1𝑁0𝑓superscript^𝑥′1𝑁0\displaystyle f(\widehat{x};\tfrac{{\bf 1}}{N},{\bf 0})\geq f(\widehat{x}^{% \prime};\tfrac{{\bf 1}}{N},{\bf 0}),italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; divide start_ARG bold_1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , bold_0 ) ≥ italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; divide start_ARG bold_1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , bold_0 ) , (57)

concluding the proof. ∎

Based on the definitions and lemmas above, we have the following theorems:

Theorem I.3 (Advantage of 𝚯Asubscript𝚯𝐴\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in the Simplified Case).

With Definition I.1 and Definition I.3, comparing 𝚯Isubscript𝚯𝐼\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I}bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, 𝚯Gsubscript𝚯𝐺\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and 𝚯Asubscript𝚯𝐴\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT by evaluating them on the marginal log-likelihood of non-stop-words, i.e., ℒ⁢(⋅,w→GT)ℒ→⋅𝑤GT\mathcal{L}(\cdot,w\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L ( ⋅ , italic_w → GT ), we have that

ℒGMM⁢(𝚯I;𝐰→GT)≤ℒGMM⁢(𝚯A;𝐰→GT)≤ℒGMM⁢(𝚯G;𝐰→GT).subscriptℒGMM→subscript𝚯𝐼𝐰GTsubscriptℒGMM→subscript𝚯𝐴𝐰GTsubscriptℒGMM→subscript𝚯𝐺𝐰GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I};% {\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{A};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{% \boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) ≤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) ≤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) . (58)
Proof.

First, by definition one can easily find that 𝚯Gsubscript𝚯𝐺\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT achieves the largest ℒ⁢(⋅;𝐰→GT)ℒ→⋅𝐰GT\mathcal{L}(\cdot;{\bf w}\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L ( ⋅ ; bold_w → GT ) among the three:

max⁡[ℒG⁢M⁢M⁢(𝚯I;𝐰→GT),ℒG⁢M⁢M⁢(𝚯A;𝐰→GT)]≤max𝚯⁡ℒG⁢M⁢M⁢(𝚯;𝐰→GT)=ℒG⁢M⁢M⁢(𝚯G;𝐰→GT).subscriptℒ𝐺𝑀𝑀→subscript𝚯𝐼𝐰GTsubscriptℒ𝐺𝑀𝑀→subscript𝚯𝐴𝐰GTsubscript𝚯subscriptℒ𝐺𝑀𝑀→𝚯𝐰GTsubscriptℒ𝐺𝑀𝑀→subscript𝚯𝐺𝐰GT\displaystyle\max[\mathcal{L}_{GMM}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I};{% \bf w}\to\mbox{GT}),\mathcal{L}_{GMM}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A};% {\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})]\leq\max_{\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}}\mathcal{L}% _{GMM}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})=\mathcal{L}_{% GMM}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).roman_max [ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G italic_M italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) , caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G italic_M italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) ] ≤ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G italic_M italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ ; bold_w → GT ) = caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G italic_M italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) . (59)

Next, we set {wi}i=1Nsuperscriptsubscriptsubscript𝑤𝑖𝑖1𝑁\{w_{i}\}_{i=1}^{N}{ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to λ1subscript𝜆1\lambda_{1}italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and {wi}i=N+1N+Nssuperscriptsubscriptsubscript𝑤𝑖𝑖𝑁1𝑁subscript𝑁𝑠\{w_{i}\}_{i=N+1}^{N+N_{s}}{ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to λ2subscript𝜆2\lambda_{2}italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, respectively; we rewrite log⁢∑k=1Kπk⁢𝒩⁢(𝐞i;𝝁k,𝚺k)superscriptsubscript𝑘1𝐾subscript𝜋𝑘𝒩subscript𝐞𝑖subscript𝝁𝑘subscript𝚺𝑘\log\sum_{k=1}^{K}\pi_{k}\mathcal{N}({\bf e}_{i};\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$% \unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k})roman_log ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_N ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) as f1,i⁢(x)subscript𝑓1𝑖𝑥f_{1,i}(x)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) for i∈{1,2,…,N}𝑖12…𝑁i\in\{1,2,\dots,N\}italic_i ∈ { 1 , 2 , … , italic_N } and f2,i⁢(x)subscript𝑓2𝑖𝑥f_{2,i}(x)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) for i∈{N+1,N+1,…,N+Ns}𝑖𝑁1𝑁1…𝑁subscript𝑁𝑠i\in\{N+1,N+1,\dots,N+N_{s}\}italic_i ∈ { italic_N + 1 , italic_N + 1 , … , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }, where x𝑥xitalic_x corresponds to 𝚯≜(𝝅,{𝝁k,𝚺k}k=1K)≜𝚯𝝅superscriptsubscriptsubscript𝝁𝑘subscript𝚺𝑘𝑘1𝐾\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}\triangleq(\mbox{\boldmath$\pi$\unboldmath}% ,\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k% }\}_{k=1}^{K})bold_Θ ≜ ( bold_italic_π , { bold_italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ). By Lemma I.1, we have that

ℒGMM⁢(𝚯A;𝐰→GT)≤ℒGMM⁢(𝚯G;𝐰→GT).subscriptℒGMM→subscript𝚯𝐴𝐰GTsubscriptℒGMM→subscript𝚯𝐺𝐰GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A};% {\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) ≤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) . (60)

Combining Eq. 59 and Eq. 60 concludes the proof. ∎

Theorem I.3 shows that under mild assumptions, the attention-based weights can help produce better estimates of 𝚯𝚯\Thetabold_Θ in the presence of noisy stop-words and therefore learns higher-quality topics from the corpus, improving interpretability of FLMs.

Theorem I.4 (Advantage of 𝚯Asubscript𝚯𝐴\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in the General Case).

With Definition I.2 and Definition I.3, comparing 𝚯Isubscript𝚯𝐼\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I}bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, 𝚯Gsubscript𝚯𝐺\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and 𝚯Asubscript𝚯𝐴\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT by evaluating them on the marginal log-likelihood of non-stop-words, i.e., ℒG⁢M⁢M⁢(⋅,w→GT)subscriptℒ𝐺𝑀𝑀→⋅𝑤GT\mathcal{L}_{GMM}(\cdot,w\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G italic_M italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ , italic_w → GT ), we have that

ℒGMM⁢(𝚯I;𝐰→GT)≤ℒGMM⁢(𝚯A;𝐰→GT)≤ℒGMM⁢(𝚯G;𝐰→GT).subscriptℒGMM→subscript𝚯𝐼𝐰GTsubscriptℒGMM→subscript𝚯𝐴𝐰GTsubscriptℒGMM→subscript𝚯𝐺𝐰GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I};% {\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{A};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{% \boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) ≤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) ≤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) . (61)
Proof.

First, by definition one can easily find that 𝚯Gsubscript𝚯𝐺\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT achieves the largest ℒ⁢(⋅;𝐰→GT)ℒ→⋅𝐰GT\mathcal{L}(\cdot;{\bf w}\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L ( ⋅ ; bold_w → GT ) among the three:

max⁡[ℒGMM⁢(𝚯I;𝐰→GT),ℒGMM⁢(𝚯A;𝐰→GT)]≤max𝚯⁡ℒGMM⁢(𝚯;𝐰→GT)=ℒGMM⁢(𝚯G;𝐰→GT).subscriptℒGMM→subscript𝚯𝐼𝐰GTsubscriptℒGMM→subscript𝚯𝐴𝐰GTsubscript𝚯subscriptℒGMM→𝚯𝐰GTsubscriptℒGMM→subscript𝚯𝐺𝐰GT\displaystyle\max[\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}% _{I};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}),\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{A};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})]\leq\max_{\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}}\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};{\bf w% }\to\mbox{GT})=\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G% };{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).roman_max [ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) , caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) ] ≤ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ ; bold_w → GT ) = caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) . (62)

Next, we invoke Lemma I.2 by (1) setting {wi}i=1Nsuperscriptsubscriptsubscript𝑤𝑖𝑖1𝑁\{w_{i}\}_{i=1}^{N}{ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to 𝝀1subscript𝝀1\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{1}bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and {wi}i=N+1N+Nssuperscriptsubscriptsubscript𝑤𝑖𝑖𝑁1𝑁subscript𝑁𝑠\{w_{i}\}_{i=N+1}^{N+N_{s}}{ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to 𝝀2subscript𝝀2\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2}bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, respectively, and (2) rewriting log⁢∑k=1Kπk⁢𝒩⁢(𝐞i;𝝁k,𝚺k)superscriptsubscript𝑘1𝐾subscript𝜋𝑘𝒩subscript𝐞𝑖subscript𝝁𝑘subscript𝚺𝑘\log\sum_{k=1}^{K}\pi_{k}\mathcal{N}({\bf e}_{i};\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$% \unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k})roman_log ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_π start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_N ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) as f1,i⁢(x)subscript𝑓1𝑖𝑥f_{1,i}(x)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) for i∈{1,2,…,N}𝑖12…𝑁i\in\{1,2,\dots,N\}italic_i ∈ { 1 , 2 , … , italic_N } and f2,i⁢(x)subscript𝑓2𝑖𝑥f_{2,i}(x)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) for i∈{N+1,N+1,…,N+Ns}𝑖𝑁1𝑁1…𝑁subscript𝑁𝑠i\in\{N+1,N+1,\dots,N+N_{s}\}italic_i ∈ { italic_N + 1 , italic_N + 1 , … , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }, where x𝑥xitalic_x corresponds to 𝚯≜(𝝅,{𝝁k,𝚺k}k=1K)≜𝚯𝝅superscriptsubscriptsubscript𝝁𝑘subscript𝚺𝑘𝑘1𝐾\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}\triangleq(\mbox{\boldmath$\pi$\unboldmath}% ,\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k% }\}_{k=1}^{K})bold_Θ ≜ ( bold_italic_π , { bold_italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ). By Lemma I.2, we then have that

ℒGMM⁢(𝚯A;𝐰→GT)≤ℒGMM⁢(𝚯G;𝐰→GT).subscriptℒGMM→subscript𝚯𝐴𝐰GTsubscriptℒGMM→subscript𝚯𝐺𝐰GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A};% {\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) ≤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) . (63)

Note that because f1,i⁢(⋅)subscript𝑓1𝑖⋅f_{1,i}(\cdot)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) and f2,i⁢(⋅)subscript𝑓2𝑖⋅f_{2,i}(\cdot)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) are Gaussian, therefore Assumption 1 and 2 in Lemma I.2 hold naturally under mild regularity conditions.

Combining Eq. 62 and Eq. 63 concludes the proof. ∎

I.2 VALC as Interpreters

As mentioned in Eq. B , the ELBO of the marginal likelihood (denoting as 𝚯𝚯\Thetabold_Θ the collection of parameters ϕ,𝜸bold-italic-ϕ𝜸\mbox{\boldmath$\phi$\unboldmath},\mbox{\boldmath$\gamma$\unboldmath}bold_italic_ϕ , bold_italic_γ and {𝝁k,𝚺k}k=1Ksuperscriptsubscriptsubscript𝝁𝑘subscript𝚺𝑘𝑘1𝐾\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}% \}_{k=1}^{K}{ bold_italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT) is as follows:

ℒVALC⁢(𝚯;{wi})subscriptℒVALC𝚯subscript𝑤𝑖\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};\{w% _{i}\})caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ ; { italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } ) =∑j=1L′𝔼q⁢[log⁡p⁢(𝐞m⁢j|zm⁢j,𝝁zm⁢j,𝚺zm⁢j)]absentsuperscriptsubscript𝑗1superscript𝐿′subscript𝔼𝑞delimited-[]𝑝conditionalsubscript𝐞𝑚𝑗subscript𝑧𝑚𝑗subscript𝝁subscript𝑧𝑚𝑗subscript𝚺subscript𝑧𝑚𝑗\displaystyle=\sum\nolimits_{j=1}^{L^{\prime}}{\mathbb{E}}_{q}[\log p({\bf e}_% {mj}|z_{mj},\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{z_{mj}},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$% \unboldmath}_{z_{mj}})]= ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ]
=∑m,jwm⁢j⁢∑kϕm⁢j⁢k⁢{−12⁢(𝐞m⁢j−𝝁k)T⁢𝚺k−1⁢(𝐞m⁢j−𝝁k)−log⁡[(2⁢π)H/2⁢|𝚺k|1/2]}.absentsubscript𝑚𝑗subscript𝑤𝑚𝑗subscript𝑘subscriptitalic-ϕ𝑚𝑗𝑘12superscriptsubscript𝐞𝑚𝑗subscript𝝁𝑘𝑇superscriptsubscript𝚺𝑘1subscript𝐞𝑚𝑗subscript𝝁𝑘superscript2𝜋𝐻2superscriptsubscript𝚺𝑘12\displaystyle=\sum_{m,j}w_{mj}\sum_{k}\phi_{mjk}\{-\tfrac{1}{2}({\bf e}_{mj}-% \mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k})^{T}\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{% k}^{-1}({\bf e}_{mj}-\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k})-\log[(2\pi)^{H/2}|% \mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}|^{1/2}]\}.= ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϕ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - roman_log [ ( 2 italic_π ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] } . (64)

Based on the definitions and lemmas above, we have the following theorems:

Theorem I.5 (Advantage of 𝚯Asubscript𝚯𝐴\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in the Simplified Case).

With Definition I.1 and Definition I.3, comparing 𝚯Isubscript𝚯𝐼\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I}bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, 𝚯Gsubscript𝚯𝐺\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and 𝚯Asubscript𝚯𝐴\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT by evaluating them on the marginal log-likelihood of non-stop-words, i.e., ℒ⁢(⋅,w→GT)ℒ→⋅𝑤GT\mathcal{L}(\cdot,w\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L ( ⋅ , italic_w → GT ), we have that

ℒVALC⁢(𝚯I;𝐰→GT)≤ℒVALC⁢(𝚯A;𝐰→GT)≤ℒVALC⁢(𝚯G;𝐰→GT).subscriptℒVALC→subscript𝚯𝐼𝐰GTsubscriptℒVALC→subscript𝚯𝐴𝐰GTsubscriptℒVALC→subscript𝚯𝐺𝐰GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I}% ;{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{A};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{% \boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) ≤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) ≤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) . (65)
Proof.

First, by definition one can easily find that 𝚯Gsubscript𝚯𝐺\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT achieves the largest ℒ⁢(⋅;𝐰→GT)ℒ→⋅𝐰GT\mathcal{L}(\cdot;{\bf w}\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L ( ⋅ ; bold_w → GT ) among the three:

max⁡[ℒVALC⁢(𝚯I;𝐰→GT),ℒVALC⁢(𝚯A;𝐰→GT)]≤max𝚯⁡ℒVALC⁢(𝚯;𝐰→GT)=ℒVALC⁢(𝚯G;𝐰→GT).subscriptℒVALC→subscript𝚯𝐼𝐰GTsubscriptℒVALC→subscript𝚯𝐴𝐰GTsubscript𝚯subscriptℒVALC→𝚯𝐰GTsubscriptℒVALC→subscript𝚯𝐺𝐰GT\displaystyle\max[\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath% }_{I};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}),\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{A};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})]\leq\max_{\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}}\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};{% \bf w}\to\mbox{GT})=\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).roman_max [ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) , caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) ] ≤ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ ; bold_w → GT ) = caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) . (66)

Next, we set ∪m{wm⁢j}j=1Nmsubscript𝑚superscriptsubscriptsubscript𝑤𝑚𝑗𝑗1subscript𝑁𝑚\cup_{m}\{w_{mj}\}_{j=1}^{N_{m}}∪ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to λ1subscript𝜆1\lambda_{1}italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ∪m{wm⁢j}j=Nm+1Nm+Nm,ssubscript𝑚superscriptsubscriptsubscript𝑤𝑚𝑗𝑗subscript𝑁𝑚1subscript𝑁𝑚subscript𝑁𝑚𝑠\cup_{m}\{w_{mj}\}_{j=N_{m}+1}^{N_{m}+N_{m,s}}∪ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m , italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to λ2subscript𝜆2\lambda_{2}italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, respectively; we rewrite ∑iϕm⁢j⁢i⁢{−12⁢(𝐞m⁢j−𝝁i)T⁢𝚺i−1⁢(𝐞m⁢j−𝝁i)−log⁡[(2⁢π)d/2⁢|𝚺i|1/2]}subscript𝑖subscriptitalic-ϕ𝑚𝑗𝑖12superscriptsubscript𝐞𝑚𝑗subscript𝝁𝑖𝑇superscriptsubscript𝚺𝑖1subscript𝐞𝑚𝑗subscript𝝁𝑖superscript2𝜋𝑑2superscriptsubscript𝚺𝑖12\sum_{i}\phi_{mji}\{-\tfrac{1}{2}({\bf e}_{mj}-\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath% }_{i})^{T}\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{i}^{-1}({\bf e}_{mj}-\mbox{% \boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{i})-\log[(2\pi)^{d/2}|\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$% \unboldmath}_{i}|^{1/2}]\}∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϕ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - roman_log [ ( 2 italic_π ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] } as f1,j⁢(x)subscript𝑓1𝑗𝑥f_{1,j}(x)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) for j∈∪m{1,2,…,Nm}𝑗subscript𝑚12…subscript𝑁𝑚j\in\cup_{m}\{1,2,\dots,N_{m}\}italic_j ∈ ∪ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { 1 , 2 , … , italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } and f2,j⁢(x)subscript𝑓2𝑗𝑥f_{2,j}(x)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) for j∈∪m{Nm+1,Nm+1,…,Nm+Nm,s}𝑗subscript𝑚subscript𝑁𝑚1subscript𝑁𝑚1…subscript𝑁𝑚subscript𝑁𝑚𝑠j\in\cup_{m}\{N_{m}+1,N_{m}+1,\dots,N_{m}+N_{m,s}\}italic_j ∈ ∪ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 , italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 , … , italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m , italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }, where x𝑥xitalic_x corresponds to 𝚯≜(ϕ,𝜸,{𝝁k,𝚺k}k=1K)≜𝚯bold-italic-ϕ𝜸superscriptsubscriptsubscript𝝁𝑘subscript𝚺𝑘𝑘1𝐾\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}\triangleq(\mbox{\boldmath$\phi$\unboldmath% },\mbox{\boldmath$\gamma$\unboldmath},\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},% \mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}\}_{k=1}^{K})bold_Θ ≜ ( bold_italic_ϕ , bold_italic_γ , { bold_italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ). By Lemma I.1, we have that

ℒVALC⁢(𝚯A;𝐰→GT)≤ℒVALC⁢(𝚯G;𝐰→GT).subscriptℒVALC→subscript𝚯𝐴𝐰GTsubscriptℒVALC→subscript𝚯𝐺𝐰GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}% ;{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) ≤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) . (67)

Combining Eq. 66 and Eq. 67 concludes the proof. ∎

Theorem I.5 shows that under mild assumptions, the attention-based weights can help produce better estimates of 𝚯𝚯\Thetabold_Θ in the presence of noisy stop-words and therefore learns higher-quality topics from the corpus, improving and interpretability of FLMs.

Theorem I.6 (Advantage of 𝚯Asubscript𝚯𝐴\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in the General Case).

With Definition I.2 and Definition I.3, comparing 𝚯Isubscript𝚯𝐼\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I}bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, 𝚯Gsubscript𝚯𝐺\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and 𝚯Asubscript𝚯𝐴\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT by evaluating them on the marginal log-likelihood of non-stop-words, i.e., ℒV⁢A⁢L⁢C⁢(⋅,w→GT)subscriptℒ𝑉𝐴𝐿𝐶→⋅𝑤GT\mathcal{L}_{VALC}(\cdot,w\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V italic_A italic_L italic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ , italic_w → GT ), we have that

ℒVALC⁢(𝚯I;𝐰→GT)≤ℒVALC⁢(𝚯A;𝐰→GT)≤ℒVALC⁢(𝚯G;𝐰→GT).subscriptℒVALC→subscript𝚯𝐼𝐰GTsubscriptℒVALC→subscript𝚯𝐴𝐰GTsubscriptℒVALC→subscript𝚯𝐺𝐰GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I}% ;{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{A};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{% \boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) ≤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) ≤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) . (68)
Proof.

First, by definition one can easily find that 𝚯Gsubscript𝚯𝐺\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT achieves the largest ℒ⁢(⋅;𝐰→GT)ℒ→⋅𝐰GT\mathcal{L}(\cdot;{\bf w}\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L ( ⋅ ; bold_w → GT ) among the three:

max⁡[ℒVALC⁢(𝚯I;𝐰→GT),ℒVALC⁢(𝚯A;𝐰→GT)]≤max𝚯⁡ℒVALC⁢(𝚯;𝐰→GT)=ℒVALC⁢(𝚯G;𝐰→GT).subscriptℒVALC→subscript𝚯𝐼𝐰GTsubscriptℒVALC→subscript𝚯𝐴𝐰GTsubscript𝚯subscriptℒVALC→𝚯𝐰GTsubscriptℒVALC→subscript𝚯𝐺𝐰GT\displaystyle\max[\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath% }_{I};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}),\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{A};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})]\leq\max_{\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}}\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};{% \bf w}\to\mbox{GT})=\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).roman_max [ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) , caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) ] ≤ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ ; bold_w → GT ) = caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) . (69)

Next, we invoke Lemma I.2 by (1) setting ∪m{wm⁢j}j=1Nmsubscript𝑚superscriptsubscriptsubscript𝑤𝑚𝑗𝑗1subscript𝑁𝑚\cup_{m}\{w_{mj}\}_{j=1}^{N_{m}}∪ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to 𝝀1subscript𝝀1\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{1}bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ∪m{wm⁢j}j=Nm+1Nm+Nm,ssubscript𝑚superscriptsubscriptsubscript𝑤𝑚𝑗𝑗subscript𝑁𝑚1subscript𝑁𝑚subscript𝑁𝑚𝑠\cup_{m}\{w_{mj}\}_{j=N_{m}+1}^{N_{m}+N_{m,s}}∪ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m , italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to 𝝀2subscript𝝀2\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2}bold_italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, respectively, and (2) rewriting ∑iϕm⁢j⁢i⁢{−12⁢(𝐞m⁢j−𝝁i)T⁢𝚺i−1⁢(𝐞m⁢j−𝝁i)−log⁡[(2⁢π)d/2⁢|𝚺i|1/2]}subscript𝑖subscriptitalic-ϕ𝑚𝑗𝑖12superscriptsubscript𝐞𝑚𝑗subscript𝝁𝑖𝑇superscriptsubscript𝚺𝑖1subscript𝐞𝑚𝑗subscript𝝁𝑖superscript2𝜋𝑑2superscriptsubscript𝚺𝑖12\sum_{i}\phi_{mji}\{-\tfrac{1}{2}({\bf e}_{mj}-\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath% }_{i})^{T}\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{i}^{-1}({\bf e}_{mj}-\mbox{% \boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{i})-\log[(2\pi)^{d/2}|\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$% \unboldmath}_{i}|^{1/2}]\}∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϕ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - roman_log [ ( 2 italic_π ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] } as f1,j⁢(x)subscript𝑓1𝑗𝑥f_{1,j}(x)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) for j∈∪m{1,2,…,Nm}𝑗subscript𝑚12…subscript𝑁𝑚j\in\cup_{m}\{1,2,\dots,N_{m}\}italic_j ∈ ∪ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { 1 , 2 , … , italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } and f2,j⁢(x)subscript𝑓2𝑗𝑥f_{2,j}(x)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) for j∈∪m{Nm+1,Nm+1,…,Nm+Nm,s}𝑗subscript𝑚subscript𝑁𝑚1subscript𝑁𝑚1…subscript𝑁𝑚subscript𝑁𝑚𝑠j\in\cup_{m}\{N_{m}+1,N_{m}+1,\dots,N_{m}+N_{m,s}\}italic_j ∈ ∪ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 , italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 , … , italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m , italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }, where x𝑥xitalic_x corresponds to 𝚯≜(ϕ,𝜸,{𝝁k,𝚺k}k=1K)≜𝚯bold-italic-ϕ𝜸superscriptsubscriptsubscript𝝁𝑘subscript𝚺𝑘𝑘1𝐾\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}\triangleq(\mbox{\boldmath$\phi$\unboldmath% },\mbox{\boldmath$\gamma$\unboldmath},\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},% \mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}\}_{k=1}^{K})bold_Θ ≜ ( bold_italic_ϕ , bold_italic_γ , { bold_italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Σ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ). By Lemma I.2, we then have that

ℒVALC⁢(𝚯A;𝐰→GT)≤ℒVALC⁢(𝚯G;𝐰→GT).subscriptℒVALC→subscript𝚯𝐴𝐰GTsubscriptℒVALC→subscript𝚯𝐺𝐰GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}% ;{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) ≤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w → GT ) . (70)

Note that because f1,j⁢(⋅)subscript𝑓1𝑗⋅f_{1,j}(\cdot)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) and f2,j⁢(⋅)subscript𝑓2𝑗⋅f_{2,j}(\cdot)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( ⋅ ) are very close to Gaussian, therefore Assumption 1 and 2 in Lemma I.2 hold naturally under mild regularity conditions.

Combining Eq. 69 and Eq. 70 concludes the proof. ∎
